citation.article-title: Five new members of the Streptomyces violaceusniger 16S rRNA gene clade: Streptomyces castelarensis sp. nov., comb. nov., Streptomyces himastatinicus sp. nov., Streptomyces mordarskii sp. nov., Streptomyces rapamycinicus sp. nov. and Streptomyces ruanii sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Streptomyces ruanii sp. nov.
Streptomyces ruanii (rua′ni.i. N.L. masc. gen. n. ruanii of Ruan, named in honour of Jisheng Ruan, a celebrated Chinese systematist).
The description is based on data taken from this and a previous study (Sveshnikova, 1957).
Rugose ornamented spores (1.1×0.8 μm) are borne in spiral spore chains of three or more turns on inorganic salts-starch agar.
On oatmeal agar the aerial spore mass colour is grey, becoming black and moist when mature, and the substrate mycelium is greyish-yellow; diffusible pigments are not formed.
Melanin pigments are not produced on either peptone-yeast extract-iron or tyrosine agars.
Growth occurs between 10 and 37 °C, but not at 4 or 40 °C, and from pH 6 to 10, but not at pH 5.0 or 11.0.
Degrades adenine, gelatin and Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80, but not cellulose, chitin, DNA, keratin, pectin, RNA, starch, tributyrin, xanthine or xylan.

d-Arabinose, d-arabitol, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, glycogen, maltose, d-mannose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, sucrose, trehalose and d-xylose are used as sole sources of carbon for energy and growth, but not aesculin, amygdalin, l-arabitol, dulcitol, glucosamine, inulin, d-sorbitol or d-sorbose (all at 1 %, w/v).
Butan-1,4-diol is used as a sole carbon source, but not methanol or propanol (all at 1 %, v/v).

l-Asparagine, l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, l-isoleucine, l-ornithine and l-proline are used as sole nitrogen sources for energy and growth, but not l-aminobutyric acid, dl-aspartic acid, l-leucine, dl-norleucine or l-norvaline.
Growth does not occur in the presence of 13 % (w/v) NaCl or 0.1 % (v/v) phenol.
Sensitive to gentamicin sulphate, kanamycin sulphate, neomycin sulphate and tobramycin sulphate (each at 8 μg ml−1).
Antimicrobial activity is shown against Bacillus cereus, Bacillus subtilis and Candida albicans, but not against Enterobacter aerogenes or Escherichia coli.
Additional phenotypic properties are shown in Table 1.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 70.5 mol%.
The type strain, ISP 5276T (=DSM 40276T), was isolated from soil.
